entry.title: Re: Important Information About Converting Renumbered G/L Accounts with an Active Parallel Line:
entry.content:
Hi @SAPFI 

My apologies for the delay; I had to check on a couple of things and then was ill for a few days. 

In brief, the scenarios are as follows: 

1.The G/L account to be renumbered is present in both the main line (ML) and parallel line (PL). 

Renumbering can be triggered only in the ML, but the automatic procedure ensures that the conversion is automatically triggered--with the same mappings--in the PL.

 

2.The G/L account to be renumbered is present only in the ML (not in the PL).Renumbering must be triggered from the ML.
3.The G/L account to be renumbered is present only in the PL (not in the ML).Renumbering must be triggered from the PL.

Hope this helps! If not, feel free to reply, and I'll happily follow up with you.

entry.title: Re: Inbound Delivery Types Assignment to Purchase Order T...
entry.content:
Confirmation control keys in SAP link purchase orders to inbound deliveries. Each confirmation control key allows only one delivery type to be assigned. Since your PO type NB is used for two different processes (103/105 and 107/109), each requiring a different inbound delivery type (LA and ZLE), the limitation prevents assigning both to the same key.

Below are workaround options

Create two separate confirmation control keys. One for the 103/105 movement type process using LA. Another for the 107/109 movement type process using ZLE. Assign the appropriate confirmation control key to the PO item based on the process.

Configure your system to assign different confirmation control keys based on material type, item category, or vendor. This allows dynamic selection of the correct delivery type during PO creation.

entry.title: How to Integrate an External Marketplace App into SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

I'm currently exploring ways to integrate an external marketplace app (such as Shopify, Amazon, or a custom-built B2B/B2C platform) with SAP S/4HANA, and I'd love to hear from others who have worked on similar integrations. I'm particularlySAP S/4HANA, SAP Commerce Cloud interested in learning about:

1. The best integration methods or tools, for example, using SAP BTP, APIs, SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration), or other middleware.
2. How you handled synchronization between the marketplace and SAP modules (orders, inventory, pricing, customers, etc.). challenges you faced around data mapping, latency, or scalability.
3. Recommendations for security, authentication, and API management when connecting external systems.
4. Real-world use cases or success stories from SAP professionals who have done this effectively.

I'm hoping this thread becomes a useful resource for developers and integration architects who want to connect marketplace apps seamlessly with SAP S/4HANA systems. Looking forward to your insights, best practices, and lessons learned!

entry.title: Error: Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 ()
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
Hello @Jitendra_Kansal78, 

I built a SAP MDK Mobile Application via the BAS. 
To do so I created two OData services in my ERP system and two destinations in my BTP account.

The creation of the apps via the CRUD template went well and also the deployment on Android and iOS mobile devices worked perfectly fine. 

I now saw that you can also choose to deploy the app as a Cloud Foundry web application. 
Initially the deployment is completed successfully, but then, when I open the generated link, I get this error message at the top of the main page:
Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 (); GET /nsJobViewerBAS_CRUD/job_infos/ Internal Server Error

I saw these two posts:

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/error-500-get-nsdemosampleapp-com-sap-edm-sampleservice-v2-internal-server/qaq-p/12753245
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/failed-to-initialize-application-data-service/qaq-p/12684025

But no real solution can be found there. I also tried to change the CSDL Options > select IgnoreAllAnnotations & ignoreAllReferences. but sadly it did not work for me. 

Please let me know if I should provide any details.

Best regards,

Manuel

entry.title: Re: I am getting a blank page when I preview my RAP servi...
entry.content:
Hello @Shyam4U 

Your 403 and blank preview aren’t a “UCON” problem in the BTP ABAP trial. It’s almost always due to authorisation or token issues with the OData service and/or preview.

I have analysed the error. I recommend the suggestion below; it will work.

Publish the binding.

  • In ADT → your service binding ZSAM_SB_DEMO89 (OData V2 – UI) → ensure Local Service Endpoint equals Published.

Assign the generated service role to yourself

  • Open the Default Authorisation Values in the binding and note the IAM App / Role Template name it produces.
  • In the ABAP (Fiori) system, go to Maintain Business Roles to create a new role using a template or the generated one. Then, assign this role to your business user in Maintain Business Users.
  • Also, ensure you have the SAP_BR_DEVELOPER business role, which is usually assigned by the trial booster.

Preview the entity set (not the root only)

  • Choose the entity set (Zsam_demo) in the binding and then click Preview…..
  • If the page is blank, open browser Network tab: now $metadata and the entity set call should be 200 OK. If it’s 403, it means step 2 hasn’t been applied to your user.

Don’t test with that curl

  • The URL http://localhost:49264/testclient/... is the ADT Test Client stub and will always return a 403 error without an OAuth bearer token. To test using curl, first get a token from your subaccount’s XSUAA, then make the call:

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"

     -H "Accept: application/json"

     "https://<your-abap-endpoint>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSAM_SB_DEMO89/Zsam_demo?$top=50

Useful SAP Documentation

SAP Help Portal – Editing Authorisation Default Values

Explains how the service binding in ABAP Environment automatically generates the authorisation scope and role, and that the user must be assigned this role to access or preview the OData service.
https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-abap-environment/abap-environment/editing-default-authorization-values

SAP Help Portal – Publish Service Binding (OData V2 / V4)
Explains how to publish the local service endpoint of your OData service before it can be accessed or previewed in a Fiori Elements app.https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/service-binding

Let me know how it goes

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Resourse Related Billing and WBS elements
entry.content:
To enable resource-related billing with WBS elements in SD, you must configure the WBS as a billing element, link it to the sales order item, and ensure DIP profiles are correctly set up to transfer posted costs.

Follow the below steps

In transaction CJ20N, open your project and select the relevant WBS element. In the “Control” tab, check the box for Billing Element. This allows the WBS to be used in SD for billing purposes.

In VA01/VA02, create or edit the sales order. In the item details under the “Account Assignment” tab, assign the WBS element. This links the SD document to the project structure.

Go to SPRO → Project System → Revenues and Earnings → Integration with SD → Maintain DIP Profiles. Create or modify a DIP profile. Define source object types (e.g., cost center, internal activity, service). Set criteria for cost selection (e.g., cost element groups). Define material determination to map costs to SD materials. Assign the DIP profile to the sales document item category or project profile.

After posting the IT invoice to a generic cost center, use transaction KB21N or KSV5 to allocate costs to the WBS elements. Ensure the costs are posted with correct cost elements that are included in the DIP profile. These costs will be picked up by DP90/DP91 when creating the billing request.

entry.title: Efficient Migration of SAC Classic Stories: Focusing on the Essentials
entry.content:
With the announcement that the creation of Classic Stories and Analytic Applications will be discontinued starting with the Q3 2025 release, planning the transition to the Optimized Story Experience is becoming a key focus for many SAP Analytics Cloud customers. The full deprecation of Classic assets is scheduled for the Q2 2026 release as stated in The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud. 

A look into the file repository of an SAC tenant that has grown over several years can quickly lead to the assumption that a massive migration project is ahead. The sheer number of existing Stories and Applications can seem overwhelming and raise the question of where to even begin with the conversion.

The good news is: in most cases, the actual effort is significantly less than you might think. The key to a successful and resource-efficient migration is not to convert all assets, but to focus on those that are truly relevant to your business.

The Reality in the System: Total Count vs. Actual Usage

In practice, only a fraction of the Stories and Applications present in the system are used regularly. Many assets are the result of ad-hoc analyses, development prototypes, or have long been replaced by more current reports. A strategy that aims for a 1:1 migration of all assets would therefore be inefficient and would spend valuable resources on content that no longer provides business value.

A strategic approach, instead, focuses on answering two central questions with data-driven insights:

  1. Which Classic Assets are actively used and must be prioritized for migration?
  2. Which assets are outdated or unused and can be cleaned up as part of a housekeeping initiative?

Data-Driven Decisions with Built-in Tools

SAP Analytics Cloud already provides the necessary tools to answer these questions. The foundation for this is the SAC_PERFORMANCE_E2E Model, which logs detailed information about content usage.

For technical users who wish to access the model directly, it can be found by following this path:

Where to Find the SAC_PERFORMANCE_E2E Model

  1. In the side menu, navigate to Files.
  2. Select the System folder.
  3. Follow the path through the folder structure: Common > SAC Content > SAC Content Performance > SAC Content Performance - Models.
  4. In this folder, you will find the SAC_PERFORMANCE_E2E model.

Based on this data, the System Overview already offers two crucial dashboards that you can use for your migration planning:

  1. System Overview Feature Adoption: SAP Analytics Cloud - Feature Adoption, this dashboard helps you identify the most-used Classic Stories and applications. You get a clear overview of which content has a high usage frequency and a broad user base. This provides an ideal basis for a prioritized migration roadmap.

  2. System Overview Housekeeping: In parallel, the housekeeping function, as described in Efficient Data Maintenance in SAP Analytics Cloud, allows for the identification of unused content. With the latest updates, this tool now even support the mass deletion of such objects. This is the perfect opportunity to clean up the tenant and improve both clarity and performance. Of course, caution is advised here to ensure that no rarely used but important reports (e.g., for quarterly or annual closing) are removed. Therefore, an analysis over a longer period is essential.

A Look Ahead: Direct Transparency in the System Overview

To make getting started with this analysis even easier, we are working on a direct integration of these key metrics into the System Overview. Soon, customers on Fast Track tenants (Wave 2025.24 Subject to change) will see a new tile called "Conversion Needed":

This tile provides an at-a-glance overview of the number of opened stories, broken down by their version (Classic, Light Weight, Unified). It immediately quantifies the proportion of Classic usage and provides a direct starting point for a more detailed analysis. This makes the abstract volume of stories to be converted tangible and reduces it to the assets that are actually in use.

Details reveal a list of Stories and Analytic Applications to be converted:

Summary and Next Steps

The transition to the Unified Story Experience is less of a technical hurdle and more of a strategic opportunity. Instead of being discouraged by the total number of Classic Assets, you should adopt a data-driven approach:

  • Identify the actively used stories with built-in tools like the Feature Adoption dashboard.
  • Prioritize their migration to achieve the greatest benefit for your users.
  • Clean up your system of unused content using the housekeeping features.

With the new "Conversion Needed" overview, we are making the first step of quantifying the need even simpler. However, it is important to note that you do not need to wait for this tile to be released to start your planning. All the necessary data to identify your most-used Classic Assets is already accessible today through the "Feature Adoption" and "Housekeeping" dashboards in the System Overview. We encourage you to leverage these tools now to gain a strategic advantage and proactively shape your migration process.

entry.title: Procurement via Service Order initiated by Solution Order
entry.content:
HI Community, 

my customer is using Solution Order and in that solution order they have service contracts assigned to it. Sometimes they  need to initiate the procurement of spare parts out of the same Solution Order. 

So the process is to have a Solution Order and a Service Contract. In addition we will add a spare part to the solution order. The system will then create a Service Order and we would assign the Service Order to the existing Service Contract. From here the 3NI Scope Item starts and so far it works. Where I'm not sure is, what happens to the Service Order? in some cases the customer would like to invoice it to the customer, in some cases no invoice is needed. It is not really clear according to the test script how we are supposed to handle the created Service Order after the service entry sheet was booked.

 

can you support here?

entry.title: Re: Event reason derivation for internal hires
entry.content:
Hi,

I think I found the reason why it wasn't working and I had those doubts about when the rule was triggered or not.

 

Answer is here. 

"

  • When Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hires in Onboarding is OFF, the rule contexts must be set to Yes only for Onboarding and No for other rule contexts.

  • When Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hires in Onboarding switch is ON, the rule contexts must be set to Internal Hire to Yes.

"

So basically when switch is enabled we need 2 event derivation rules (if we want to use rules to send the event reason). One for external onboardess using rule context onboarding and one for internal onboardees using internal hire. Even if it is the same rule, we can't have the rule with both rule context enabled because onboarding rules only work when onboarding rule context is the only one enabled.

If that's correct I think it would be great to add a comment here.  If I'm not correct I'd appreciate some comments.

Cheers,

Francisco

entry.title: Re: The valuation class cannot be changed, choose 'Displa...
entry.content:
Hello @khan_786 

Here is the explanation:

  • current period 10.2025 - stock 10 PCS, current stock
  • previous period 09.2025 - stock 20 PCS, stock at the end of September

You have to clear the stock both in the current and in the previous period in order to change the valuation class. You can post to previous period by putting posting date of September 2025 in MIGO. That is assuming that fiscal year is the same as the calendar year in your company code.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: List of Product in Storage Location (SAP Cloud, Publi...
entry.content:
Hi @LouiseG ,

Yes, your analysis is correct. There is no standard report to display the product list by storage location. You can use the standard CDS view I_ProductStorageLocationBasic to create a custom CDS view and build a report on top of it. This report can then be published as a custom app and assigned to specific users for easy access like a standard Fiori application. Else by using Export Master Data-Product use you can download the required data. Please let me know if you need further details.

Regards,

Vinith K

entry.title: Re: List of Product in Storage Location (SAP Cloud, Publi...
entry.content:
Hi @LouiseG ,

Yes, your analysis is correct. There is no standard report to display the product list by storage location. You can use the standard CDS view I_ProductStorageLocationBasic to create a custom CDS view and build a report on top of it. This report can then be published as a custom app and assigned to specific users for easy access like a standard Fiori application. Else by using Export Master Data-Product use you can download the required data. Please let me know if you need further support.

Regards,

Vinith K

entry.title: Re: 1,500× Faster: ABAP Cloud API with “Just” Gzip
entry.content:
I'm more impressed by the quality of your post than the gain of performance 😉

Could you please confirm: if for some reason, for instance the project wants OData only (not clear why), a "bulk" OData service is developed with a base64 string property containing the ~3 MB per 1M rows (gzipped), it shouldn't be so much slower than a minimal HTTP service like you did, right?

Something else: you are zipping via CL_ABAP_GZIP and you use "Content-Encoding: gzip", doesn't it compress twice? (By the HTTP client in the SAP kernel.) What is the interest?

Thank you.

entry.title: Maintenance Order Not Showing in Capacity Scheduling Board (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m currently working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and I’m facing an issue with the capacity scheduling integration between Maintenance (PM) and Production (PP).

Here’s my scenario:

  • I created a maintenance order for an intervention on an equipment located on a production line.

  • The operation duration was set to 1 hour.

  • I released the order and confirmed that a work center was assigned at the operation level.

  • The work center is the same one used for the production line (so that the maintenance activity should ideally impact the production capacity).

However, when I open the Capacity Scheduling Board (production scheduling application):

  • The available capacity remains unchanged,

  • The graph does not show any maintenance order,

  • Even though the legend includes “Work Orders”, nothing is displayed on the chart.

I already checked the following:

Order is released (REL)
Equipment has a valid work center assigned 

Still, the maintenance order does not appear on the capacity scheduling chart.

My questions to the community:

  1. Should maintenance orders appear in the production capacity scheduling board, or are they visible only in the Maintenance Scheduling Board?

  2. If it’s possible to visualize PM orders in the production capacity board, what configuration is required (order type, capacity category, or work center linkage)?

  3. Is there any restriction in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition that prevents PM orders from influencing PP capacity load?

Any insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated 

Thanks in advance,

KHARBOUCH Mohamed

entry.title: Re: RAP unmanaged if_rap_query_provider~select change htt...
entry.content: Hi @DungVT37, Im not sure what you mean with dump in frontend, but as mentioned raising the exception will leead to an HTTP 500 Internal Server error. No messages are being display on the UI in this case. The query implementation acts like a DB query. The DB will either return the data or an error code, no additional messages.

entry.title: Re: MIRO transaction PO details is not showing
entry.content:
Hi,
Please find below the steps to resolve user authorization issues in MIRO

1. Compare User Roles
Use transaction SU01 to check the roles assigned to your user ID.
Compare with a user who can see the PO details in MIRO.
Look for roles related to: MM (Materials Management)
Invoice Verification Purchasing and GR access

2. Check Authorization Objects
Use SU53 immediately after trying MIRO and not seeing PO details.

This shows the failed authorization check.
Common objects to look for:
M_RECH_WRK – Plant authorization
M_RECH_EKG – Purchasing group
M_RECH_BSA – Document type
M_RECH_AWR – Company code

3. Use ST01 Trace (Advanced)
If SU53 doesn’t help, run ST01 trace while executing MIRO.
Filter for authorization checks.
This will show exactly which object and field is causing the block.

4. Request Role Adjustment
Once you identify missing roles or objects, contact your SAP security team or basis administrator.
Provide the SU53 or ST01 output and request the necessary access.

5. Test Again
After roles are updated, log out and back in.
Retry MIRO and confirm if PO details are now visible.

entry.title: Re: New Cloudification Repository Viewer for Clean Core Governance and Development
entry.content:
Hi @samedtekdemir3594 ,

"Use in Cloud Development" relates to the contract (C0, C1, C2). It can be e.g. that the APi is released but only for the contract C1 but not for the contract C0: can be used in developments but not for extensibility.  The Properties View in ABAP development tools for Eclipse provides this information. See more details on contracts under https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-development-tools-user-guide/released-apis.  "Released" on Cloudification Repository means you can use it in ABAP Cloud developments (standard ABAP developments are always supported). If your API is not released for C1 contract and you try to use it in your development inside the system, you will get syntax error when using ABAP Cloud language version. For Level B developments classic APIs are used, not released for ABAP Cloud, therefore the language version should be standard ABAP.

Kind Regards,
Olga.

entry.title: How can I master the digital business transformation to achieve high and sustainable user adoption?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Managing the People Side of SAP Cloud Projects   learning journey. 

Learning outcome
After the completion of this learning journey, you will be able to plan and implement organizational change management through all SAP Activate phases of a cloud project. You will gain the ability to identify and engage stakeholders, set up and execute effective communication, assess change impacts, set up a solid learning and enablement approach, prepare the organizational transition and drive the adoption of the SAP solution. This will enable you to get certified as SAP Associate in Organizational Change Management.

Goals

  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Basic knowledge of project management, preferably in the context of SAP cloud implementation projects
 
 
Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: iRPA issue when making Web Service Call to DOX
entry.content:
What we do to upload the document and get the DocID is to Generate options - upload

return {
    method: 'POST',
    url: '/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs',
    responseType: 'json', 
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    timeout : 200000,
    metadata:[
        {
            name:'file',
            file: filePath,
            type:'application/pdf'
        },{
            name:'options',
            value:'{"schemaId":"****your schema id","clientId":"default","templateId":"detect","enrichment":{}}',
            type:'text/json'
        }
    ]
};

 
And Call web service with destination


I hope can help!

entry.title: Re: Budget for Spot Award Programs (Rewards & Recognition)
entry.content: If you consult the What's New Viewer there are changes coming to the budget calculation to make it less manual. However, as each program is a separate template the budgets cannot be shared as the programs are not connected. This operates the same way as Compensation as Variable Pay. Budgets cannot cross templates. This would need to be submitted as an enhancement request - though I can see it being problematic for the traceability of spend to budget when there are multiple spend sources.

entry.title: Re: Building Sustainable Supply Chains: From Design to Reuse
entry.content:
This is a fantastic and timely piece—thank you for articulating the full lifecycle view of sustainability in supply chains. As a Senior IBP Supply Chain Consultant, I especially appreciate the emphasis on integrating sustainability into planning processes. The shift from cost-centric to impact-aware planning is not just strategic but essential in today’s regulatory and environmental landscape.
The examples around EUDR-certified materials and the use of SAP IBP to simulate emissions and flag ESG risks really resonate. It’s encouraging to see how SAP’s suite of solutions; from Green Token to Sustainability Footprint Management can empower organizations to move from compliance to competitive advantage.
Looking forward to seeing more real-world case studies and best practices on how companies are operationalizing these concepts. Kudos to Cristian Butzlaff for driving such transformations.

Warm Regards,

Rahul Mohnot

entry.title: Re: Error in SLT data replication DMC_RT_MSG229 - Cannot...
entry.content:
Well it turns out that the problem indeed started after a refresh. We had to open an SSO with SAP to repair some process, and follow the guide in SAP Note 3438605, mainly steps 2.1.1 -> 2.1.2 -> 2.1.3 -> 2.4.5.2 -> 2.4.5.5. The key is that this error only did go away after the transparent table for the logging table appears in TADIR, so if it's not there, this note might solve your problem

Thanks,

Erick Grilo

entry.title: 9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin 

SAP TechEd in Berlin is just around the corner and it’s not your typical tech conference: it’s where SAP Community comes home. To help you make the most of your time on-site, here are 9 must-know ways to experience the community in action. 

1. Connect at the Community Clubhouse 

Think of this as your community hub. It’s the place to meet other members alongside the SAP Community team, swap ideas, share experiences, and just hang out with people who are as passionate about SAP as you are.  Come join your community in Hall 1.2  

2. Dive into the Developer Garage 

The Developer Garage is a hands-on playground where you can work alongside Developer Advocates on real projects. With 7 tracks and 32 tutorials, it’s the perfect space to get practical experience and try out the latest SAP technologies. 

3. Learn from the Experts 

From product owners in AI, ABAP, and CAP to SAP Champions and Mentors, the “Meet the Experts” tables are where you can ask questions, get insights, and gain practical tips straight from the people building SAP solutions. 

4. Explore the Community Theatre 

Catch 33 community talks, participate in trivia competitions, and check out the DemoJam at the end of Day 1 (15:00–16:15 Berlin time, session DJ1295), hosted by Mr. Bluebeard himself. Teams will have 6 minutes to tackle a real business challenge using SAP BTP, showcasing innovation, creativity, and fun. Stop by the Community Clubhouse to see who takes home the DemoJam trophy.  

5. Explore Learning and Certification Opportunities 

SAP TechEd in Berlin offers a dedicated space for certifications. Learn what certifications are available, understand their value, and even take free onsite certification exams for SAP Generative AI Developer and SAP Build Developer in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville. Find more details and register for the exam. 

6. Step into the SAP TechEd Experience Center 

Discover the future of enterprise technology, from Business AI to live robotic demos. Experience gamified learning, explore customer use cases, and take home a smart tag and learning badge to continue your journey long after the event.  Make your way to Hall 3.2 for all the experience center has to offer. 

7. Get to Know the SAP Community Platform 

Whether you’re new or seasoned, the SAP Community info space will help you navigate the platform, find groups, and even learn how to become an event organizer or start a local location group. 

8. Connect with Mentors and Champions 

Curious about the SAP Mentors or SAP Champions programs? Stop by booth 103 in the Clubhouse, learn about the programs, and discover how you can become more involved in the community. 

9. Don’t Miss the Developer Keynote 

The developer keynote is a highlight for anyone interested in the latest innovations and the roadmap of SAP technologies. 

SAP TechEd in Berlin isn’t just about sessions and workshops, it’s about being part of the SAP Community in real life. Whether you’re rolling up your sleeves in a hands-on tutorial, swapping stories at a casual meetup, or catching insights from an expert talk, every corner of the event is designed to help you connect, share, and grow alongside fellow community members. 

We can’t wait to see you there! Come ready to learn, share, and be part of the SAP Community energy 🤝

entry.title: Inquiry on Support for Additional Tactical Dashboard Features in SAP Focused Run
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

 

We are currently working on enhancing the capabilities of the SAP Focused Run (FRUN) Tactical Dashboard and would like to confirm whether the following features are supported or can be implemented:

  1. Display of OS Mirror Patch Level.
  2. Kernel details including End of Support (EoS) information and recommendations for the next kernel level.
  3. Display of Software Component Versions.
  4. Alerting mechanism to notify when any monitored parameter turns red.
  5. Display of Extended Maintenance Support Timelines for components.
  6. Support for Java systems in the Tactical Dashboard.

 

Could you please confirm if these features are currently available in the latest version of FRUN or if there are any planned enhancements to support them? Additionally, any guidance or documentation on how to implement or configure these features would be appreciated.

 

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Re: I want to see the relevant Billing documents for a sa...
entry.content:
Hi Ramuy,
As you explain the relevant billing documents for sales order in sales volume flexible analysis is not included. To include credit and debit memos in the Sales Volume – Flexible Analysis app, you need to adjust the selection criteria and ensure the correct key figures and document categories are enabled in the report configuration.

Steps to Include Credit and Debit Memos in the Report
Check the Document Category Filters The Flexible Analysis app (F1250) may default to showing only standard billing documents (e.g., invoices). To include credit and debit memos, the app and go to the filter bar.

Add or adjust the filter for Billing Document Type or Document Category.

Include types like:

  • L2 – Credit Memo
  • L1 – Debit Memo
  • S1 – Cancellation Invoice (if relevant)

Enable Relevant Key Figures Some key figures like Net Value of Credit Memos or Net Value of Debit Memos are not shown by default.

Click on the gear icon or “Settings” in the report.

Add key figures such as,

  • Net Value of Credit Memos
  • Net Value of Debit Memos
  • Sales Volume Quantity (adjusted) – if available, this includes credit/debit adjustments.

Hope the above explanation help you.

entry.title: Re: 🟡 Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest 🐱🐶🐵🐷🐻🐸🐔🐴🦬🦎🐠🦜🐧🐌🐛
MCP: A Comprehensive Guide
entry.content:
What You’ll Learn in this Guide

In this comprehensive guide to the Model Context Protocol (MCP), we explore how MCP simplifies AI integrations by standardizing the way AI systems connect with external tools and data sources.

By the end, you’ll understand how MCP transforms complex, one-off integrations into a seamless, interoperable ecosystem.

We’ll cover:

Why MCP: The Problem with AI Integrations
What is MCP
MCP Architecture: Host, Client, and Server
Demo

1) Why MCP

To understand why the Model Context Protocol (MCP) matters, we need to trace the evolution from LLMs to AI Agents, and then to MCP as the missing interoperability layer.

1.1 The Problem with LLMs

While powerful, Large Language Models (LLMs) have four critical limitations:

Outdated knowledge
No access to external or real-time data
Limited context windows
Risks of hallucination

1.2 From LLMs to AI Agents

To overcome these challenges, AI Agents emerged — capable of accessing tools, invoking APIs, and making real-time decisions.

However, this evolution created a new problem: integration complexity.
Each AI agent or application needed custom integrations with multiple APIs, data sources, and tools — leading to fragmented, brittle connections.

1.3 The Problem with Agents Accessing Tools

In the traditional approach, every model must directly integrate with every tool — an M×N problem.

Example:
3 AI models × 3 tools = 9 separate connections.
Each integration is custom-built and non-reusable, resulting in a fragile and hard-to-maintain web of connections.

This approach doesn’t scale. As the number of AI models and tools grows, integration overhead increases.

Solution — The MCP Approach

MCP replaces the M×N complexity with a simple, scalable M+N model.

Each AI model and each tool integrates once with the MCP layer.
This single standard interface allows any AI model to access any tool seamlessly — without custom connectors.

In short, MCP turns AI integration from a one-off engineering effort into a plug-and-play ecosystem for tools, data, and intelligence.

2) What is MCP

MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an open-source standard that defines how AI applications communicate with external systems through a unified interface.

It enables interoperability between different AI agents, tools, and platforms — regardless of their language, framework, or runtime environment.

With MCP, developers can build AI solutions that dynamically discover and invoke new tools securely and consistently.

3) MCP Architecture: Host, Client, and Server

MCP follows a client-server architecture similar to web protocols, but tailored for AI interaction.

It consists of three main components:

MCP Host — Manages and exposes available tools

MCP Client — Initiates requests to discover and use tools

MCP Server — Implements tool capabilities and exposes them to clients

3.1 MCP Server core capabilities

3.2 Interaction Model

The following diagram illustrates the interaction between the Host, MCP Server, and MCP Client.

This modular structure allows AI systems to dynamically discover, invoke, and orchestrate tools through a standardized layer — without direct coupling between tools and models.

3.3 Real-World Example: SAP MCP Servers

SAP has released MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model), UI5, and Fiori development environments.

With these MCP servers, AI agents can now assist developers contextually — understanding project structure, metadata, and domain models to offer precise, real-time help in CAP, Fiori, and UI5 projects.

This demonstrates how MCP can be embedded into enterprise ecosystems, bridging AI assistance with actual business development workflows.

4) Demo

The following demo illustrates these concepts in action:
https://github.tools.sap/I572601/mcp-demo

Demo 1 shows the integration challenges without MCP.
Demo 2 demonstrates how MCP simplifies integration and tool discovery through a unified protocol.

These demos make the shift from manual, fragile integrations to MCP-driven automation immediately clear.

Key Takeaways

MCP simplifies AI integrations by replacing point-to-point connections with a single standard interface.
Interoperability is built-in — any AI agent can use any MCP-compliant tool.
Scalability improves as new tools or models can be added without re-engineering integrations.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM) Writing to S/4 HANA Public Cloud using SOAP API
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

As you read the blog post's title, I'm sure you're excited to get to the interesting section where you'll discover how to use SOAP Service to write to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

The public cloud version of SAP S/4 HANA offers equivalent SOAP APIs, which can be leveraged in the Universal Model. This flexibility enables you posting documents not just in SAP S/4 HANA On-premise, but also in the SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

For more information, see SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud SOAP APIs.

Now allow me to demonstrate your prerequisites and procedures.

Prerequisites

  • You must have an existing SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model subscription. More information, Account Setup.
  • You must have an existing SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud.

Scenario

You were able to read data records from SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in context of the recent blog post SAP PaPM Cloud Standard and Universal Model OData Integration with S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Now, you are required to sent back the calculated data records from Universal Model using SOAP Service.

Procedure

1.     Creation of Communication User and System

You may follow the same approach of the Creation of Communication User and System from the mentioned blog post above on our scenario but without ticking the box Inbound Only.

Then add a User for Inbound and Outbound Communication.

For more information about the procedure, see Create a Communication System with Inbound and Outbound Users.

2.     Creation of Communication Arrangements

For this blog post, let’s use the Journal Entry by Ledger – Post (Asynchronous).

In the procedure from the official documentation of Create Communication Arrangement. Proceed on creation of Communication Arrangement.

3.     Creation of Destination

Create the Destination according to the configuration that you have created from previous steps.

Fields

Values

Name

S4HC_DEST

Type

HTTP

Description

Destination for using SOAP Service SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud

Proxy Type

Internet

URL

<api-url of your communication arrangements>

Authentication

BasicAuthentication

User

<Your Communication User>

Password

<Your Communication Password>

Additional Properties

sap-client :<your s4hc client>

For reference, see image below.

4.     Creation of Connection

Since you already have the Destination, you may now proceed on the creation of Connection in Universal Model.

For the Journal Entry by Ledger - Post (Asynchronous), you may refer for the Models and Fields that are being used for the General Ledger posting.

If you want more detailed fields that I have added, please refer to SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM) Posting Strategy via SOAP Services as it uses the same use case for Journal Entry.

Once all Models and Fields are configured, you may now proceed on pressing the Sync Models button to generate the Model Entities that will be used as a Result Model function in your Writer.

For more information, see Manage Connections.

5.     Setting up of Writer function

You can maintain the Connection created from previous procedures and Model in your Writer function.

Configure the mapping of fields according to what you have added from previous procedures.

With this configuration, when you Run the Writer function, it will generate a Message ID that we can check in SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

6.     Validation of Posting in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud

In the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud Message Monitoring for Administrators, you will be seeing an Interface /FINANCE – JRNLENTRIN – 00001 that you can open to search the Message ID from generated from Universal Model.

Once opened, search the Message ID.

It will show the status of posting and returns the Document number accordingly by SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud.

Disclaimer: All data like Connection names, message IDs, document numbers and other examples are our dummy records. And this is only to showing how you can use SOAP Service in Universal Model.

And that will be it for this blog post! I hope you have learned now how you can setup the writing of SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model to your SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Cloud.

See you again onto the next topic!

entry.title: Re: Custom Business configurations for S/4 HANA 2023 private cloud edition: Some tips & Tricks
entry.content:
hi @michael_smithe5 : As far as i know there no standard way to create a separate tile for these objects. The only way it can be created is to develop a custom Fiori app on top of these tables. I would suggest that you reach out to SAP product support and take their advice if this is possible or not.

Regards

Anirban

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Asset Management – The Link Collection
entry.content: @daniel_salles you are faster than us! 🙂  The blog is now updated with the latest blog post. Thank you!

entry.content: Hi,
